SENT.plain: Two patients with angiographically proven longitudinal sinus thrombosis were studied from a coagulation point of view
In the first case, marked primary thrombocytosis was found
This patient was treated with aspirin, dipyridamole and radioactive phosphorus
In the second case, fibrinogen and whole blood plasma viscosity were elevated
This patient developed deep vein thrombosis of the left leg a few weeks after the cerebral episode and was treated with coumarin drugs
The importance of a coagulation study in every patient with cerebral vein thrombosis is emphasized
